_header: A fools bolt / Is soon I-shotten
Note:
Cf. 714, line 421; 2800, st. 7; cf. also Tilley (1950)
XTilley, Morris Palmer. A Dictionary of the Proverbs in England in the 16th and 17th Centuries. Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan, 1950, F. 515; Meech (1940)
XMeech, Sanford Brown. “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” Modern Philology 38 (1940-41): 113-32, 130.

Bod9.Transcription: A folys bolt is sone y schoten
Bod9.Note:
Incorporated in 5530,
                    where it is a single line (not a couplet) which rhymes with ‘Del with no
                    good þat is mysgoten’.
Bod9.Editions:
Schleich,  Gustav,
                        ed.  
             “Die sprichwörter Hendings und die Prouerbis of Wisdom.” 
             Anglia
         51 (1927): 220-77: 224.

BodRawD328.Transcription: A foleys bloteys sone y shote
BodRawD328.Note:
Translating vt dicunt multi sic transit lancia stulti, which
                    follows; English portion all written on one line.
BodRawD328.Editions:
Meech,  Sanford Brown. 
             “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” 
             Modern Philology
         38 (1940-41): 113-32: 121.

BodRawPoe32.Transcription: A ffole is bolt is sone I shote
BodRawPoe32.Note:
Occurs in 5530, where it
                    is a single line (not a couplet).
BodRawPoe32.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius. 
             “The Prouerbis of Wysdom.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         90 (1893): 241-68: 246.

BLHar2321.Note: Added to right margin by a later hand.
BLHar2321.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.208.
